marketNews.title: Investment Realization 2025 Targeted to Increase +15.5% YoY
marketNews.content: Minister of Investment Rosan Roeslani said the government targets investment realization of 1,905 trillion rupiah in 2025, up 15.5% year-on-year compared with the 2024 target. Cumulatively, the government targets total investment realization of 11,855 trillion rupiah for the 2025-2029 period. The breakdown is as follows: Rosan claimed that the 1,905 trillion rupiah target for 2025 could boost economic growth to +5.6% YoY, higher than the government's own target of +5.2% YoY and the International Monetary Fund's projection of +5.1% YoY. Rosan mentioned that the sectors to be focused on are green investment, connectivity infrastructure, energy transition and downstream processing, as well as export-based investment. On the other hand, Rosan noted that the limited budget of the Ministry of Investment in 2025 could hinder the achievement of the investment target. The ministry's budget fell 44.5% YoY to about 681.9 billion rupiah in 2025, only 43.4% of the planned budget requirement. Key Takeaway: If achieved, higher investment realization prospects could provide a positive catalyst for banking issuers such as BBCA, BBRI, BMRI and BBNI as a proxy for Indonesia's economic growth. In addition, the government's focus on export-based and downstream investment could benefit infrastructure downstream providers such as AKRA, which operates the JIIPE industrial zone.

marketNews.title: RAPBN 2025 Macro-Economic Assumptions Approved by DPR
marketNews.content: Chairman of the DPR Budget Committee Said Abdullah said the government and the DPR have reached an agreement on macro-economic assumptions for the 2025 state budget (RAPBN). Said noted that most of the budget assumptions in the President's initial proposal presented on 16 August 2024 were approved, except for the rupiah-to-dollar exchange rate, which was revised stronger from 16,100 to 16,000, the 10-year sovereign bond yield, which was revised down from 7.1% to 7.0%, and the oil lifting target, which was revised up from 600,000 barrels per day to 605,000 barrels per day.

marketNews.title: US Manufacturing PMI August 2024
marketNews.content: The Institute for Supply Management reported that the US manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) rose slightly to 47.2 in August 2024 (versus 46.8 in July 2024), below the consensus expectation of 47.5. The result marks the 21st month of contraction in factory activity over the past 22 months.

marketNews.title: China Manufacturing PMI August 2024
marketNews.content: S&P Global reported that China's manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) rose to 50.4 in August 2024 (versus 49.8 in July 2024), surpassing the consensus expectation of 50.

marketNews.title: Study on Coal Royalty Tariff Adjustment
marketNews.content: The Secretary of the Directorate General of Mineral and Coal (Ditjen Minerba) of the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, Siti Sumilah Rita Susilawati, said the government is still studying adjustments to royalty tariffs for holders of special mining business licences (IUPK). According to the Acting Executive Director of the Indonesian Coal Mining Association, Gita Mahyarani, the current IUPK royalty rates are considered heavy and far from market conditions. The same view was expressed by the Executive Director of the Indonesia Mining Association, Hendra Sinadia, who said the current royalty tariffs are challenging amid declining coal commodity prices and rising operating costs.

marketNews.title: August 2024 Layoffs in Indonesia
marketNews.content: Minister of Manpower Ida Fauziyah said the number of workers affected by layoffs (PHK) as of 8M24 reached 46,240 people, representing 71.3% of the total layoffs realized in 2023, which amounted to 64,855 people.

marketNews.title: Increase of FLPP Housing Loan Facility Quota 2024
marketNews.content: The government increased the quota for the Housing Financing Liquidity Facility (FLPP) for 2024 from 166,000 housing units to 200,000 units. This step was taken as the previous FLPP quota was almost exhausted.

marketNews.title: US DOJ Subpoenas Nvidia
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that the US Department of Justice has issued a subpoena to Nvidia Corp. (NASDAQ: NVDA) seeking evidence that the company violated antitrust laws. The action follows US antitrust authorities' concerns that Nvidia may impede the transition to alternative suppliers and punish buyers who do not exclusively use its artificial-intelligence chips. Following the report, Nvidia's share price fell 9.53% on Tuesday, 3 September.

tickerNews.title: KARW: Meratus and AD Ports negotiations end without agreement
tickerNews.content: ShippingWatch reported that negotiations between Meratus Group, the parent of Meratus Jasa Prima, and AD Ports, a port operator from Abu Dhabi, have ended without an agreement. However, ShippingWatch noted that Meratus Group and AD Ports remain open to possible cooperation. Previously, Bloomberg reported in November 2023 that AD Ports planned to acquire Meratus through a $2 billion deal.

tickerNews.title: GOTO: GoTo to close Vietnam operations on 16 September 2024
tickerNews.content: GoTo Gojek Tokopedia announced that the company will cease operations in Vietnam on 16 September 2024. GoTo said the move is taken to sharpen the company's focus. According to GoTo, the Vietnamese market is highly fragmented with many players in transportation and food delivery. GoTo believes the decision will not have a significant impact because Vietnam contributed less than 0.5% of the group's Gross Transaction Value (GTV) and 2% of the on-demand services GTV in 2Q24.

tickerNews.title: BYAN: Bayan Resources acquires 99% of PT Enggang Alam Sawita for IDR 105.2 billion
tickerNews.content: Bayan Resources together with its subsidiary Bayan Energy announced that it has acquired PT Enggang Alam Sawita from PT Berau Utama Berkatsetia for IDR 105.2 billion. After the transaction, PT Enggang Alam Sawita is owned 99% by BYAN and 1% by Bayan Energy. PT Enggang Alam Sawita is a palm oil plantation company with land inside and adjacent to BYAN's mining concession. The transaction is intended to support the smooth operation of BYAN.

tickerNews.title: AVIA: Director Ruslan Tanoko purchases 4.2 million AVIA shares
tickerNews.content: Avia Avian director Ruslan Tanoko bought 4.2 million AVIA shares at an average price of IDR 473.2 per share on 29-30 August 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately IDR 2 billion. After the transaction, Ruslan Tanoko's ownership in AVIA increased from 0.04% to 0.047%.

tickerNews.title: CUAN: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi secures IDR 775 billion loan from BBNI
tickerNews.content: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi signed a credit facility of IDR 775 billion with Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI), with a term until 30 August 2030. The facility is intended to finance the company's general activities.

tickerNews.title: BBLD: Buana Finance obtains IDR 500 billion loan from Bank Jago
tickerNews.content: Buana Finance signed a credit facility worth IDR 500 billion with Bank Jago (ARTO). The facility has a tenor of three years and is intended for consumer finance lending.

tickerNews.title: MEDC: Medco Energi International provides IDR 25 billion loan to subsidiary
tickerNews.content: Medco Energi International granted a loan facility of IDR 25 billion to its subsidiary PT Satria Raksa Buminusa. The loan carries an interest rate of 8.95% per annum and has a term until 31 August 2027.
